EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of two stone furnaces positioned at (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0), each served by adjacent burner‑inserters and connected to wooden chests, managing the input and output of smelting operations.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of a burner‑mining drill located at (–15.0, –50.0) paired with a nearby wooden chest at (–13.5, –51.5) integrated into a transport‑belt network, ensuring efficient extraction and distribution of iron ore.

### Steam Power Generation System
Consists of a boiler at (8.0, 20.5) with connection points at approximately (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5) and multiple steam engines positioned at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5), and (4.5, 23.5). An extra steam engine intended to expand the system remains unplaced due to severe spatial congestion.
Use-case: Generates power through steam operations while highlighting the need for resolving placement conflicts to maximize capacity.

### Automation Research Lab
Configured for automation science pack research, the lab continues to suffer from unstable power connectivity.
Use-case: Advances research in automation despite current power challenges.

### Electrical, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure
Comprises interconnected electrical poles, numerous belt groups, and extensive pipe groups spread across the map.
Use-case: Provides an integrated backbone for coordinated distribution of power, materials, and fluids.

### Offshore Pump and Fluid Network
Consists of an offshore pump positioned at (0.5, 30.5) feeding into a network of connected pipe groups.
Use-case: Supplies water into the fluid system to support various process operations.

────────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Persistent Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to extreme spatial congestion in the boiler zone centered at (8.0, 20.5), with the designated clear buildable area near (8.5, 22.5) repeatedly obstructed by overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts.  
  – Recommendation: Conduct a thorough manual inspection of the boiler area and its adjacent connection interfaces; remove, reposition, or adjust interfering entities to free up sufficient space, or consider relocating the extra steam engine or modifying the boiler layout.

• Fuel Supply Shortages in Burner‑Powered Entities  
  – Burner‑inserters and the burner‑mining drill frequently report “out of fuel” or “waiting for source items,” interrupting smooth operation.  
  – Recommendation: Ensure fuel sources are placed immediately adjacent to burner‑powered machines and verify that transport‑belt routing consistently delivers fuel to these stations.

• Steam Engine Connectivity and Fluid Input Deficiencies  
  – Multiple steam engines generate warnings for not being connected to the power network and for lacking necessary input liquid, indicating issues with wiring and fluid piping configurations.  
  – Recommendation: Reassess and reconfigure electrical connections and fluid pipelines to secure reliable network integration and adequate liquid input for all steam engines.

• Laboratory Power Instability  
  – The Automation Research Lab continues to experience unstable power connectivity, undermining research progress.  
  – Recommendation: Reevaluate the placement and wiring of nearby electrical poles and associated power infrastructure to stabilize the lab’s power supply.
